greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table of x AND y, where (x,y) = (0,0),(0,1),(1,0),(0,2),(1,1),(2,0),...
comment: Or, table of AND(i,j), i >= 0, j >= 0, read by antidiagonals. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 08 2016
Or, table of (i+j-Nimsum(i,j))/2) read by antidiagonals [Winning Ways, p. 75]. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 22 2019
reference: E. R. Berlekamp, J. H. Conway and R. K. Guy, Winning Ways, Academic Press, NY, 2 vols., 1982, see p. 75.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
example: The AND(i,j) table (shown without commas or spaces) begins:
maple: # Maple code for first M rows and columns of AND(i,j) table
for n from 0 to M-1 do lprint(f1(n)); od:
mathematica: Table[BitAnd[k, n - k], {n, 0, 20}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 01 2017 *)
program: tabl(nn) = {for(n=0, nn, for(k=0, n, print1(bitand(k, n - k), ", "); ); print(); ); };
print([k&(n - k) for k in range(n + 1)])
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
